intro: Senegalia painteri, commonly known as the painted acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to the arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and bipinnate leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, which bloom during the rainy season. Its seeds are enclosed in long, slender pods that split open to release the seeds when mature. Senegalia painteri is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh environments.
